Shorter or more flexible contracts available at different rates, eg. 3 month contract +Â£50pcm, 1 month contract +Â£100pcm.FAQ's...How many people in the house? It's a 6 bedroom, 2 bathroom, former luxury family home. There are usually 7-9 people in total. It also has a large kitchen/diner overlooking the garden and a spacious lounge. It's quiet but sociable.What are the other housemates like? It varies over time but a mix of UK and international young professionals. 95% of the time housemates become lifelong friends and it's a pleasure to manage.What's the deposit & contract? No restrictive contracts, only Â£200 deposit. You must have photo ID, a valid debit/credit card (any bank), proof of income and attend our interview/viewing. We issue you with a standard Tenancy Agreement - Standard issue is a 6 month initial term contract, extendable thereafter. Shorter or more flexible contracts available at different rates, eg. 3 month initial term +Â£50pcm, 1 month initial term +Â£100pcm.How far are you from the tube? It's a brisk 12 min walk. So it's not round the corner from the tube but you get more house for your money and it's perfectly doable. We are 5 min from a high street which also has the Thameslink train which is super useful to some.Are there any extra charges? No, you just pay your first month's rent. You will have to contribute to the household kitty for cleaning products, toilet paper etc and bring your own towels and bed linen, apart from that all bills are included.

Beautiful large double bay window room to let, fully furnished, all bills included.Available from the 14th Feb 2026.Sunny ensuite double room in a stylish 4 bed Edwardian house. in a friendly residential neighbourhood right next to the wide open spaces of Gladstone Park. It's minutes from shops, buses and trains in Willesden, Cricklewood, Kilburn and Brent Cross. All bills and fortnightly room cleaning are included.The room is large, with a bay window, a desk, easy chair and a new double bed. You have a private ensuite bathroom, including toilet, basin and beautiful blue tiled shower, as well as your own kitchenette with fridge, sink, microwave, toaster and kettle. There's  a shared washing machine and more cooking facilities in the utility room upstairs. Plentiful storage with a roomy wardrobe, chest of drawers, shelves and cupboard. Outside thereâ€™s a lovely garden with hammock or you can take a stroll to leafy Gladstone Park at the end of the road and visit community run Cricklewood Library, with classes, events and cafe.Sharing the house are live-in landlords Steve and Sally, and one other lodger in the loft room with their own facilities. The household includes two free range Siamese cats who will come to check you out, and our Italian Greyhound Sukie, who keeps to the ground floor. We are all well behaved, love our home, and we're up for a chat and a glass of wine. Itâ€™s a warm and sociable environment, but equally itâ€™s easy to keep to yourself. It is not a party house and thereâ€™s no smoking in the house at all.Amenities: high speed broadband and Virgin 200MBs wifi throughout, central heating, two washing machines, garden & terrace plus very local park for jogging or sport. Parking available in CPZ at cost. Secure bicycle parking in side alley.Transport links round here are great and numerous - the Jubilee line at Willesden Green (Jubilee line zone 2) about 10/12 minutes walk away, or Dollis Hill (Jubilee line zone 3, 10 minutes across the park). Alternatively, there are lots of buses to town from Cricklewood Broadway, and overland trains at Cricklewood Station (St Pancras, London Bridge, etc)We are looking for a new lodger, professional, artist or student,  of any nationality. The house suits people who are busy and sociable, but like their own space. Full-time is great, Monday-Friday would also work, and we will consider short or long term lets.Please get in touch if you think our room might suit you - weâ€™re happy to answer any questions.

detail: Modern double bedroom and ensuite available to rent in a beautiful 2700sq ft two floor flat on quiet road in Belsize Park, NW3. Perfect for a single, tidy, good humoured, non-smoking professional :-)YOUR ROOM :Your light and airy double bedroom and ensuite with jacuzzi bath has just been refurbished to an exceptionally high standard, providing you with a calm oasis to relax and unwind after a busy day at work.The double bed has a comfortable orthopaedic mattress and padded leather headboard. Your Samsung Smart TV is brand new so you can watch movies or browse the internet from your bed ! NB - There is superfast WiFi throughout the flat.The bedroom furniture is custom made from fair trade teak and there is plenty of storage space in both the bedroom wardrobe / cupboards and new white bathroom units.THE APARTMENT :Our beautiful spacious apartment has been completely renovated. The floors are hardwood or Amtico with stylish rugs. Each bedroom has been individually designed with Farrow & Ball colour eco paint and co-ordinated soft furnishings.The large communal area with an open plan kitchen / dining area which has wall to wall sliding windows and roof lights that maximise the winter daylight and make it very bright and airy in the summer. You will have your own cupboard and half a fridge and freezer to fill.The cleaner helps keep everything spic and span, though we are looking for someone who is clean and tidy and will add a minimal amount to her workload !The utility room has a new washing machine and tumble dryer for you to use.NB - Due to various allergies, including washing powder, we have a policy of Ecover and organic products in the washing machine and for general household cleaning.We are a smoke free household with no pets.AVAILABILITY :The large double room is available for you to move in from 28 December, so please do not hesitate to get in touch.RENT :We are ideally looking for a full time lodger, however if you are looking to rent Monday to Friday do send us a message, for the right person, we would be happy to consider this option too.POTENTIAL HOUSEMATE:Are you looking to share with people who have a healthy and active lifestyle, are passionate about optimising their personal well-being, prefer to eat organic and love living near Primrose Hill? Do get in touch for a chat.THE AREA :Belsize Park is a vibrant community with an array of independent coffee shops, cafes, restaurants, pubs and an Everyman cinema (with comfy seats and a great bar). There is a wonderful bookshop (Daunt Books), along with the small Antrim Road library and the huge Swiss Cottage library.For your food shopping in Belsize Park you have a choice of Budgens or Pomona (organic fruit & veg) and also Morrisons (in Chalk Farm), Waitrose (on Finchley Road) and a Tesco just around the corner in Englandâ€™s Lane.The nearest gyms are the Swiss Cottage Sports Centre or The Armoury depending on your exercise preference.All 791 acres of Hampstead Heath (with its open air swimming ponds) are a 15 minute walk away, and Primrose Hill is 10 minutes in the other direction, so you can go for a walk or a run before work or when you get home !TRANSPORT CONNECTIONS :The property is extremely well connected and is ideally located for all manner of transport into both the West End and the City.TUBE : You have easy access to Zone 2 stations on both the Northern Line (Belsize Park and Chalk Farm tube stations are 5 minutes walk away) and the Jubilee Line (Swiss Cottage tube is 10 minutes away).BUSES : There are numerous bus routes going directly to Euston, Waterloo; Finchley, Brent Cross; Oxford Street, Piccadilly Circus, Aldwych; Notting Hill, Kensington, Westfield; Highgate, The Whittington, Archway. Bus routes #46, 168, 268; #C11 and # 13, 31, 82, 113, 187.OVERGROUND TRAIN : Stations at Hampstead Heath (10 mins walk) or Finchley & Frognal (15 mins walk) connect to Richmond / Clapham Junction & Stratford, change at West Hampstead to connect with Thameslink for Luton & Gatwick.ROAD LINKS / MOTORWAYS : The A41 (Finchley Road) passes Swiss Cottage; you can join the North Circular at Brent Cross (10 mins by car); the M1 starts at Staples Corner (15 mins drive away) and from there connect to the M25 / M40 / M4 / M11.CAR : Once the flat becomes the registered address for your car, you can apply to Camden for a parking permit.We look forward to meeting you and showing you round in person or virtually :-)

detail: A newly modernised 2 bed flat available right in London's social/cultural heart on the border of St John's Wood and Kilburn.The new design has focused on liveability, social interaction and luxury with an abundance of storage space, it makes excellent use of space available.What this lacks in size it more than makes up for in style. The beautiful and spacious living area features an open plan kitchen / lounge with a separate nook for reading or working and has been described as "warm" and a "really nice space". The comfortable sofa bed allows for additional guests to stay.The newly refurbished bathroom features a generous wet room with multiple shower options including body-jets.The bedrooms are small but both have decent storae. One comes with a built in wardrobe and generous storage space under the raised king sized bed platform. The single room has a cupboard and shelving space.The kitchen has a new dishwasher, gas hob, quality coffee machine, and lots of storage space. There is fast and reliable wifi, resident caretaker and a passenger lift.The Mock Tudor style block has recently has been updated with a stylish 1920's style foyer. It comes with a private communal garden and is about a 3 minutes walk to a dozen different bus routes and Kilburn High Road station which is 2 stops (10 minutes) to Euston. Kilburn Park tube on the Bakerloo line is minutes away too. The local area is full of shops, restaurants and cafes. The wider area features beautiful walking spots and landmarks like the Abbey Road studios (Beatles) pedestrian crossing, Lords Cricket Ground and Hampstead HeathThe flat comes fully furnished and ready to move in. The rent includes all bills so there are no extra costs. Offers under the asking price will be considered.

I have a room for rent in my renovated flat located just north of Kings Cross, off Camden Square in a secure, well looked after, small and friendly estate.As mentioned the flat has had a complete renovation, new kitchen with lovely oak work surfaces and new bathroom with shower and bath, all very stylish and contemporary. The front room and kitchen have been made open plan to make a large airy space, also new walnut wooden flooring has been installed, and the whole flat has had a full repaint.The room for rent measures 3.00m x 2.50m, it is furnished with a double bed and brand new mattress, a set of drawers and an in-built wardrobe.In terms of amenities, there is a washing machine, dishwasher and fiberoptic broadband and a fully equipped kitchen. I have also installed a home cinema as I'm am a massively in to film, which any potential flatmate will be welcome to use.In terms of transport, the flat is very centrally located and fantastically connected. Camden Town Tube (northern line) /Camden Overground are 10mins walk, as is Kings Cross.Caledonian Road Tube (Piccadilly Line) and Caledonian Road & Barnsbury Overground are also 10mins walk. The 390 and 274 buses run from directly outside the flat, less than a minutes walk, which gives easy access to the West End, Angel, Camden Town and Archway.Personally, I work as a professional portrait photographer, and am ideally looking for someone who has similar interests, or that works in the creative industries, although this is not a necessity. I am ideally looking only at professionals, but mature students will be considered.I spend time with friends in the evening, but also spend a fair amount of time at home chilling out, watching films, listening to music and occasionally having friends over. I love cooking and am more than happy to make the occasional meal. I would expect any potential flatmate to be respectful that its is my home and not party house and ideally treat it like their own home too!Cleaning is also split, but its wooden floors and doesn't  take much to keep clean, but getting a cleaner is always an option too.Get in contact if your interested, and we can organise a viewing!ThanksLuke

About the AreaThe house is a terraced property situated in a quiet residential street, only a short walk from the Jubilee line (Dollis Hill and Willesden Green stations). The Jubilee Line connects to central London (15 minutes to Bond Street), there are also bus services from Willesden Green High Street. This attractive neighbourhood is well serviced by supermarkets, (Sainsbury's, Co-Op), pharmacies, restaurants, cafes, and bakeries. Also, there is the lovely Gladstone Park, a short walk away, which is lovely in the summer. There are also numerous sports facilities in and around the park.About the houseThe ground floor of the house consists of a large living and dining room, a good-sized well-equipped kitchen with lots of storage, fridges, and a washing machine. In the house, there are two bathrooms, one upstairs and one downstairs, which are split between the 4 flatmates. Each bathroom has a bath and a shower. The house is well-insulated, and all the windows are double-glazed. There is a lovely private garden with plenty of space and an outdoor gas BBQ, which is perfect for summer. There is a shared driveway for parking, and there is a garage that is used for storage.The RoomThe room is a large double bedroom, located on the first floor. It has a Large Bay window that faces the front of the property allowing lots of natural light in. This bedroom is very spacious and has a built-in wardrobe so there are plenty of options for utilising the space it currently does not come with a bed.Bills are not included in the rent but currently come to approximately Â£140 per person per month. This covers all the usual things such as Council tax, broadband, power, gas, etc.The FlatmatesWe are three professionals, two male, and one female, and we are preferably seeking other like-minded professionals to share the house with. We use the lounge, our rooms, or the pub in the evenings. We are not a party household and respect each otherâ€™s privacy. If you want to spend time in your own room, away from it, thatâ€™s fine too. We are looking for people who are friendly, responsible, and willing to join the team as we trust each other in the house. We have a cleaning rota, for the common areas, which you will be responsible for once a month.So, if you are clean, friendly, and trustworthy we would love to meet you and have a chat!

Hey there!I'm sad to be leaving my room in a lovely split-level 4 bedroom flat in Kensal Rise and am looking for a replacement to take over the tenancy from January. The remaining tenants - Amy, Satori and Maxine - are late twenties and are searching for someone of similar age who is looking for a new home and flatmates to call friends.Amy is a project manager for an EdTech company, Satori is an Events Executive and Maxine is a Consultant. They are fantastic housemates, friendly and respectful of each other's space. We all liked to grab the occasional pint and catch up at the pub downstairs or pop out for a show/movie in the evening and are hoping for the new housemate to have a similar vibe.The flat is above a family-friendly pub that has regular pub quizzes and delicious roasts. The room on offer is a first floor double and comes furnished with a bed and storage and is near the kitchen (perfect for midnight snacks). The flat has two bathrooms and 2 fridge-freezers in the kitchen alongside a washing machine and separate dryer. The landlord is super responsive and fast to sort out any issues and is contactable directly (though an agency handles the contract).The flat is in a cute area with 2 bakeries in walking distance, charity shops and a small Tescos near Kensal Rise station. There is also a gym less than 5 minutes down the road and a large Sainsburys about a 15 minute walk away. We're 5 minutes from Kensal Rise station (Mildmay Line); 10 minutes from Kensal Green and Queen's Park (Lioness and Bakerloo line), and are well placed on bus routes towards Notting Hill and Paddington.If youâ€™re interested, shoot us a message with some info about yourself! Double room with double bed, desk, chair, shelves, etc. available in Temple Fortune, North London. Â£950 per month which includes ALL bills (yep, Electricity, Gas, Water, 1Gig internet and Council Tax).The flat is in a great neighbourhood, only five minutes walk from Golders Green tube station (Northern line) - which is a few stops to Camden, 20 mins to Bank station/City or the West End. Great local amenities: choice of supermarkets, coffee shops/cafes, restaurants and takeaways, gym five mins walk away, a 24 hour shop a few doors down, collection points for every courier service. We have a modern kitchen with all the usual stuff like a dishwasher, automatic bean-to-cup coffee machine, oven, microwave, fridges and freezer, etc. There is one bathroom with a shower and toilet (with bidet seat!). There's also a utility room with a washer & dryer machine.Current flatmates are: a graphic designer/composer/music producer, an actor/filmmaker, and a PT/influencer. Yeah it's all men, but it's not all lads lads lads. It's usually the news on the TV and we're interested in left-wing politics. No Andrew Tate fans should apply. Or anyone adament that children are being forced into being trans (ffs).The atmosphere is very chilled and relaxed, never any arguments, and really we don't want any drama brought to the house. Here are some examples of previous problems we've had which has resulted in people having a swift exit:-Move in, and then two weeks later announce they can't pay the rent-Be threatening and aggressive to the others after getting drunk on cheap lager every night-"Secretly" move their girlfriend in (we will know...)Pretty obvious stuff really! We're all professionals who are too old for that kind of student lifestyle. Having said that we're a pretty social bunch, and go for house visits to pubs / restaurants / clubs / cinema / Barry's Bootcamp.We are on a main road, but we have double glazing throughout - and the room available has additional secondary glazing to further reduce noise so it's pretty quiet. We have a tado system on the heating so the temperature in the bedroom can be set. The kitchen is also our communal area with cinema-style motorised recliner seats and a 65" TV, so it's pretty much a combined kitchen and living room. Also there's also an outside terrace, with a bench and barbecue. And realistic fake grass/dodgy looking real plants.Cheers
